javadoc: A dialog that has text fields to get user input.

methods.javadoc:
Creates a provider for a generic input dialog with the specified title, a text field, labeled by the specified label. The user should check the value of "isCanceled()" to know whether or not the user canceled the operation. Otherwise, use the "getValue()" or "getValues()" to get the value(s) entered by the user. Use the tool's "showDialog()" to display the dialog.

@param dialogTitle used as the name of the dialog's title bar @param label value to use for the label of the text field
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a provider for a generic input dialog with the specified title, a text field,
 labeled by the specified label. The user should check the value of
 "isCanceled()" to know whether or not the user canceled the operation.
 Otherwise, use the "getValue()" or "getValues()" to get the value(s)
 entered by the user. Use the tool's "showDialog()" to display the dialog.

params.name: dialogTitle
params.comment: used as the name of the dialog's title bar

params.name: label
params.comment: value to use for the label of the text field

methods.javadoc: Returns if this dialog is cancelled.
methods.name: isCanceled
methods.comment: Returns if this dialog is cancelled.

methods.javadoc: return the value of the first (and maybe only) text field

methods.javadoc: return the values for all the text field(s)
methods.name: getValues
methods.comment: return the values for all the text field(s)

methods.javadoc: reset all the text fields to their initial values

methods.comment: reset all the text fields to their initial values
